metadata.Title: CVE-2020-22032 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A heap-based Buffer Overflow vulnerability exists FFmpeg 4.2 at libavfilter/vf_edgedetect.c in gaussian_blur, which might lead to memory corruption and other potential consequences.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-22032` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm3
libav-tools - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm3
libavcodec-extra - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm3
libavcodec-ffmpeg-extra56 - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm3
libavcodec-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm3
libavdevice-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm3
libavfilter-ffmpeg5 - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm3
libavformat-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm3
libavresample-ffmpeg2 - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm3
libavutil-ffmpeg54 - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm3
libpostproc-ffmpeg53 - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm3
libswresample-ffmpeg1 - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm3
libswscale-ffmpeg3 - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in esm-apps/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm3').
vice package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
